context:
At a quarter to six, Mrs Alison heard her husband park(停车) the car outside the house and at once went out to speak to him. "What's the matter?" he asked. "You look upset(沮丧)." "I have made a terrible mistake(错误), Jim, " she said. "Mrs Johnson called me half an hour ago. We got talking and then without thinking, I asked her and her husband to come and have dinner with us this evening."
"Well, that's nothing to get upset about," Mr Alison said. "We will have a pleasant evening. We haven't seen the Johnsons for a long time."
"I'd like them to come,"answered Mrs Alison. "but I've just found there is almost not any food in the house. You didn't remember to buy some steak (牛排). I asked you to get some on your way home from work three days ago."
"Steak?" Mr Alison said. "Oh, my dear, yes, I remember now. I did get some. You ought (应该) to have reminded (提醒) me about it. It's in the car. It's been there for the past three days!"

questions.text: Mrs Alison got upset when she <blank>.

choices.A: heard her husband park the car outside the house
choices.B: went out to speak to her husband
choices.C: asked Mrs Johnson and her husband to come and have dinner
choices.D: found that there was little food in the house

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mrs Alison got upset when she found that there was little food in the house.

choices.C: at about a quarter past five

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mrs Johnson called Mrs Alison half an hour ago, and Mrs Alison heard her husband park the car at a quarter to six. So Mrs Johnson called Mrs Alison at about half past five.

questions.text: Mr Alison would like the Johnsons to come because <blank>.

choices.A: they haven't seen each other for a long time
choices.B: he bought some steak three days ago
choices.C: there was no food in the house
choices.D: Mrs Alison has made a terrible mistake

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mr Alison would like the Johnsons to come because they haven't seen each other for a long time.

questions.text: Mrs Alison told her husband to buy some steak <blank>.

choices.A: on his way to work three days ago
choices.B: on his way home three days ago
choices.C: on his way home from work in three days
choices.D: on his way to work after three days

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mrs Alison told her husband to buy some steak on his way home three days ago.

choices.C: bought some steak and forgot it in the car
choices.D: was too busy to buy some steak

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Mr Alison bought some steak and forgot it in the car.
